monster.name: Paper Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine.

languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the paper golem remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary sheet of paper.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The paper golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Ink Blot {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the paper golem applies ink to itself. The next time it hits a creature with a paper cut attack, the creature must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The paper golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Paper Cut
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) косой урон.
{@i A seemingly ordinary piece of paper leaps to life and lashes out with its sharp edges.}

entries.name: Reams of Danger
entries: Though a single paper golem can protect the spellbooks of paranoid spellcasters, it is far more formidable when in the form of a swarm.

entries.name: Protector of Secrets
entries: Once the paper golem has been created, it patiently lies in wait, dormant until an unsuspecting creature happens upon it.

entries.name: Poisoned Manuscripts
entries: The ink of the paper golem is imbued with magic, creating a toxin to use against its victims.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: Голему не нужны ни воздух, ни еда, ни питье, ни сон.

monster.name: Paper Golem Swarm

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine.

languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: As the paper golem.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: As the paper golem.

trait.name: Ink Blot {@recharge 4}
entries: As the paper golem, except it can also apply to the swarm's whirlwind.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The paper golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through any opening large enough for a piece of paper. The swarm can't regain hp or gain temporary hp.

action.name: Paper Cut
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hp or fewer.

action.name: Whirlwind {@recharge 5}
entries: The air is momentarily filled with paper golems. Each creature within 5 feet of the swarm must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i A seemingly ordinary piece of paper leaps to life and lashes out with its sharp edges.}

entries: Голему не нужны ни воздух, ни еда, ни питье, ни сон.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Голем невосприимчив к любому заклинанию или эффекту, который изменит его форму.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Голем имеет преимущество в бросках спасения против заклинаний и других магических эффектов.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Оружейные атаки голема являются магическими.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The golem deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks and one catapult attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Catapult
entries: The war machine golem hurls a boulder at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The war machine golem breathes fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Beyond Boulders
entries: War machine golems can be built with alternate forms of ammunition for their catapults. When creating such a variant, substitute the appropriate damage for the appropriate damage type. For example, golems with ballistae on their heads deal piercing damage while those that sling flaming pitch deal fire damage. All other effects of the catapult attack remain the same.
{@i A tavern-sized, iron construct crushes everything in its path, sweeping away enemies and walls with one swipe of its mighty fist. The top of its head sports a catapult launching boulders.}
War machine golems are 40-foot-high, self-piloting siege weapons powered by dwarven engineering and necromancy.

entries.name: Fueled by Dead Dwarves
entries: It takes a battalion of dwarf engineers a decade to manufacture a body for a golem war machine. Once the body is constructed, a circle of five necromancers summons the spirits of the dwarves' ancestors. Infused with these spirits, the body comes to life. The construct is bound to a master by the circle of necromancers at the time of the spirit infusion, usually a dwarf general. If the golem loses its master, it follows its last order and then lies dormant until another circle of necromancers is assembled to cast a ritual to bind the construct to a new master.

entries.name: Fueled by Dead Dwarves
entries: Голему не нужны ни воздух, ни еда, ни питье, ни сон.

monster.name: Wood Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine.

languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: rThe golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: rThe wood golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wood golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

{Some golems are made by the concentrated work of dozens or hundreds of priests, wizards, or other enchanters, focusing all their efforts on a suitably impressive display of their god's power or their arcane mastery. Others are thrown together by apprentices on a bet or just to prove that hair can, indeed, be animated as a construct. The latter are the lesser golems, a set of golems that are rather easy to create but are often rather feeble when compared to their full-fledged brethren.}

entries.name: Mundane Materials
entries: The lesser golems of hair and mud are simply animated piles of those materials. Those made of glass and wood are sturdier and often ornamented in some fashion but are far less robust that iron or clay.

entries.name: Temple and Workshop Helpers
entries: In many instances, a lesser golem is conjured or animated to remove some of the drudgery of daily tasks. Initiate priests ask a hair golem to sweep the floors and remove spent candles from chapels. Apprentice alchemists set mud or glass golems to stir cauldrons, pulverize noxious minerals, or feed fires.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: A lesser golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Expansive
entries: A creature at least one size smaller than the goliath longlegs can travel through and finish its turn in the goliath longlegs' space.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While a goliath longlegs remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from other plants or trees.

trait.name: Forest Camouflage
entries: The goliath longlegs has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in forested terrain.

trait.name: Vulnerable Legs
entries: The goliath longlegs has eight legs. While it has more than four legs, the goliath longlegs is immune to being knocked {@condition prone} or {@condition restrained}. Whenever the goliath longlegs takes 20 or more damage in a single turn, one of its legs is destroyed. Each time a leg is destroyed after the fourth one, the goliath longlegs must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. Any creature in the goliath longlegs' space or within 5 feet of it when it falls {@condition prone} must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goliath longlegs makes one bite attack and then as many leg attacks as it has legs. It can use its Reel in place of two leg attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hp, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hp, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Paralytic Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition paralyzed} effect on itself on a success. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 15} Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12; hp 15; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Reel
entries: The goliath longlegs pulls one creature caught in its web up to 30 feet straight toward it. If the target is within 10 feet of the goliath longlegs, the goliath longlegs can make one bite attack as a bonus action.
{@i A spider the size of a large house, with legs that could pass for trees, moves through the forest.}
Solitary hunters, goliath longlegs sit motionless for long periods of time, waiting for unsuspecting prey to walk beneath them.

entries.name: Stealthy Ambush Predators
entries: The legs of a goliath longlegs mimic the size and texture of the trees of the forest in which it resides. It uses this natural camouflage to its advantage, hiding its body in the crowns of the nearby trees.

entries.name: Venomous Weapons
entries: The goliath longlegs' legs are vulnerable to attack, so it prefers to poison its prey with a paralyzing nerve agent.

entries.name: Unknown Origin
entries: Not much is known about the origin of this species. They are few in number, and, when one is discovered, word rarely gets back to civilization.

trait.name: Bloodthirsty
entries: If 6 or more gorelings are within 30 feet of one another, they become frenzied and their attacks deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Swarming
entries: Up to five gorelings can occupy the same space.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Multiplying
entries: When a goreling is hit but not reduced to 0 hp, it splits into two new gorelings. Each new goreling has 1 hp, doesn't have this reaction, and is one size smaller than the original goreling.
{@i Bits and pieces of ground-up flesh and bone given unholy life shuffles forward, eager to feed.}
Gorelings are a necromancer's answer when there just isn't enough flesh around to create a full zombie. During a fight, a chopped off appendage or two can be converted into a handy minion.

entries.name: Torturous Hunger
entries: It is said that within each goreling is a fragment of the dead creature's soul. It seeks out the flesh of living things, desperately trying to make itself whole again.

entries.name: Leftover Parts
entries: Gorelings come in a variety of shapes and sizes, since they are made of whatever is lying around, including whole eyes, ears, fingers, and organs. The sight of one is unsettling, often even for a necromancer.

entries.name: Cannibal Tendencies
entries: If no living flesh is available for a goreling to consume, it will cannibalize another goreling. Specimens become larger and larger as they absorb more and more flesh. Thankfully, most decay away to nothing before they get to be too big, but a massive goreling has been mistaken for a flesh golem more than once.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: The goreling doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Fleshbag
entries: The behemoth starts with two arms and two legs. If it loses one arm, it can't multiattack. If it loses both arms, it can't slam. If it loses one leg, its speed is halved. If it loses both legs, it falls {@condition prone}. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

trait.name: Flesh Wound
entries: At the end of any turn in which the behemoth took at least 30 damage, roll a {@dice d8}. On a 1, it loses an arm. On a 2, it loses a leg. In addition, 2 ({@dice 1d4}) {@creature zombie|mm|zombies} fall {@condition prone} in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of the behemoth, spilling from the wound.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
entries: The grave behemoth and any zombies within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Zombie Keeper
entries: Zombies created by a grave behemoth's Flesh Wound and Hurl Flesh share a telepathic link with it, are under its control, are immune to necrotic damage, and act immediately and on the grave behemoth's initiative.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grave behemoth makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Gorge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hurl Flesh {@recharge 5}
entries: The grave behemoth vomits putrid flesh and 5 ({@dice 2d4}) {@creature zombie|mm|zombies} in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 38 ({@damage 11d6}) necrotic damage and is covered in rotting slime for 1 minute. On a success, a target takes half the necrotic damage and isn't covered in slime. A creature, including the target, can take an action to clean off the slime. {@creature zombie|mm|Zombies} under the grave behemoth's control have advantage on attack rolls against creatures covered in a grave behemoth's slime.
{@i A massive giant reeking of rotting flesh shambles forward. Its rubbery skin constantly ripples as if living things are trapped underneath.}

entries.name: Weapon Against Giants
entries: In the past, a necromancer kingdom neared destruction from rampaging giants. Their undead were not sufficient to defeat the giants, so they turned to even darker arts. The necromancers flayed the flesh off hill giants, keeping the skins mostly intact, and stuffed the resulting sacks of flesh full of humanoid bodies before sewing it back together. Then, they enveloped their creations in necrotic energy until the giant flesh animated. . . along with the zombies trapped inside.

entries.name: Out of Many, One
entries: A grave behemoth is more than the sum of its grisly parts. The dark ritual forms a hive mind between the behemoth and its zombie tenants, which act as an extension of the behemoth's will.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A grave behemoth doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Headsman's Woe
entries: If the green knight's head is severed by a vorpal weapon or by other means, magical vines sprout from its neck and the head reattaches by the start of the green knight's next turn, preventing the green knight from dying from the loss of its head.

trait.name: Knight's Challenge (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the green knight targets one creature that it can see within 30 feet and issues a challenge. If the target can see the green knight, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become magically compelled to engage the green knight in melee combat for 1 minute, or until the knight challenges a new opponent. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
On its turn, the affected creature must move towards the green knight and make a melee attack against the green knight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The green knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The green knight can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The green knight makes two attacks. one with its battle axe and one with its shield bash.

action.name: Battle Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} by magical vines springing forth from the green knight's shield, and the green knight can't make shield bash attacks against other targets.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.
{@i Clad in emerald green plate mail and a cloak woven from leaves, this mysterious knight wields a mighty battle axe. A shield decorated with greenery is strapped to his arm.}

entries.name: Fey Champions
entries: Green knights serve the Fey Lords and Ladies, acting as their champions and protecting those ancient forests where the borders between the Material Plane and the lands of the fey are thin. They are creatures of honor, and they are sometimes sent by a fey noble to test the integrity and honesty of a mortal knight by challenging the mortal to a duel or other contest. Beneath their plate armor, green knights appear as heavily built humanoids with a greenish tinge to their skin.

entries.name: Forest Hideaways
entries: Green knights make their homes in "green chapels" deep in the woods. These places are sometimes ruined churches or keeps overgrown with moss, vines and other foliage, or hidden forest gorges guarded by {@creature Woodwose|CCodex|woodwoses} or other fey creatures. Green knights often ride green‑skinned, fey warhorses into battle (use warhorse statistics with the Magic Resistance trait and plate barding).

reaction.name: Knight's Rebuke
entries: When the green knight is hit by a melee attack from a creature it has successfully challenged, it can make one battle axe attack with advantage against the attacker.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The grindylow can mimic humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The grindylow has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The grindylow can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grindylow makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) колющего урона.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the grindylow can't use its claws on another target.

action.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 20-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the grindylow if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink.
After releasing the ink, the grindylow can use the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.

{@i This creature has a fishlike head that is almost triangular in shape, sloping down and outward toward its wide mouth, filled with small, sharp teeth. Large eyes stare unblinking from its hideous face. A scrawny chest, covered in fish scales, supports two long, wiry arms which end in three clawed digits. Its lower body resembles the long tail of an eel.}

entries.name: Menace of the Shallows
entries: Grindylows live in small bands of a dozen or so individuals, primarily in warm, coastal waters. Often hunted down by merfolk, they are quick to ingratiate themselves with other intelligent predators like the sahaugin in the hopes of gaining some protection. In this way, they often find themselves absorbed into the cults of their allies, dedicated to demon lords and malevolent sea gods.

entries.name: A Taste for Fear
entries: Grindylows don't care much about religious pursuits, however. Their single passion in life consists of lurking in tide pools, rivers, and lagoons, where they wait for gnomes, halflings, or human children to come near the water's edge so they can leap up with their long, wiry arms and drag their victims under the water. They eat what they kill in this manner, but this is a matter of convenience. Their true enjoyment is derived from the attack and the fearful reactions of their prey, not the resulting meal.

entries.name: Murderous Mimics
entries: Grindylows have some talent at voice mimicry which they sometimes use to lure creatures closer to the shore, but the most use this talent sees is in the recounting of the screams of their latest or greatest successes.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Gugalanna doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Gugalanna has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Gugalanna's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If Gugalanna moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a horns attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, Gugalanna can make one kick attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gugalanna makes two attacks. one with its horns and one with its kick.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 5d10 + 7}) piercing damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Kick
entries: Gugalanna makes a kick attack.

legendary.name: Rearing Stomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Gugalanna spreads his wings and stomps his hooves, shaking the earth. Each creature within 10 feet of Gugalanna must make a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 20 feet away from Gugalanna. On a success, a target takes half the damage and isn't pushed. Gugalanna can then fly up to half his flying speed.

legendary.name: Blazing Sun Disc (Costs 2 Actions, {@recharge 5})
entries: The sun disc floating between Gugalanna's horns flares. Each creature within 30 feet of Gugalanna must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i A large black bull rips up the earth in great heaps. White wings spread wide from his shoulders, and a burning sun disc floats between his white horns.}
Gugalanna, "The Great Bull of Heaven Who Makes the Earth Shake," is an instrument of Heaven, sent to trample enemies into dust. The sun disc between his horns makes clear his authority.

entries.name: Wrath of the Divine
entries: Gugalanna often arrives in times of war, torture, slavery, or oppression in answer to prayers by the poor or the plague-ridden. While rare, these forms of divine intercession occur often enough that evil-doers are familiar with some of its ways and portents. Shining clouds are said to foretell Gugalanna's arrival, as are flowers blooming in midwinter or on the altars of dark gods.

entries.name: A Friend to Brother Ox
entries: The animal lord {@creature Brother Ox|CCodex} seems to be a friend to Gugalanna; the two sometimes work together.

entries.name: Hatred of Blood Magic
entries: The biggest source of evil that brings Gugalanna's attention is the use of blood magic. The use of this form of magic invariably involves blood sacrifices, ritual murder, and other horrors. Gugalanna shakes down the pillars of temples devoted to such activities.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The gulon can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing. When it moves through an area smaller than its normal space, it excretes waste in a 5-foot cube. This waste is difficult terrain and creatures crossing through it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The gulon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gulon makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) косой урон.

action.name: Too Full {@recharge 5}
entries: The gulon belches a 15-foot-radius cloud of toxic gas around itself. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i This creature has the face and claws of a great cat but a body covered in the shaggy reddish fur of a fox. It moves like a canine, its insatiable mouth dripping with drool.}
Gulons are forest-dwelling predators addicted to meat. They are known to attack any flesh-based creature they come across, even those much larger than themselves.

entries.name: Insatiable Gluttons
entries: Gulons take immense pleasure in eating. One of these creatures gorges itself on a meal until it can consume no more, then finds two trees very close together. The monster then forces itself through the space between the trees to discharge the food from its body through violence. Once this disgusting process is complete, the gulon continues feeding. Travelers who find large piles of waste between two trees should turn back-for they are in gulon territory.

entries.name: Adventurous Eaters
entries: When a gulon picks up the scent of a creature it has never tasted before, the monster hunts that quarry to the ends of the earth. Gulons have an innate drive to consume as many different kinds of meat as possible. If a gulon is drawn out of its territory following a potential meal, it may wander into a civilized area full of new meaty delights, and it may not leave that new hunting ground for days or weeks.

entries.name: Eating and Mating
entries: Gulons are typically solitary animals, but males do make annual migrations in the spring to seek out a female's territory. If a female accepts a male, they spend weeks hunting together. The male returns to its territory near the end of the season and the female gives birth to a litter of gulon pups that leave the territory when they mature.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: As a bonus action, the gumienniki can change its form into a Tiny housecat, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form except it loses its flaming hand scythe attack when in cat form.

trait.name: Through Grass and Sheaves
entries: The gumienniki's speed is doubled when traveling over grassy areas or through planted crops.

action.name: Flaming Hand Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiendish Blink (1/Day)
entries: The gumienniki flashes its glowing eyes, illuminating a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area that can see the gumienniki must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Taunting Cackle
entries: When the gumienniki is missed by an attack, it can taunt the attacker. The attacking creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on its next attack roll or saving throw.
{@i These stooped creatures resemble elderly humans with cranberry‑colored skin and bright, glowing eyes. They dress in loosely-woven clothing made from hay and foul leather strips.}

entries.name: Bargainers
entries: Gumienniki strike fiendish bargains with willing farmers. They offer to protect silos and storehouses from vermin, thieves, and fire in return for a steady supply of livestock. Most of these bargains end poorly for the farmer, who soon discovers that the gumienniki doesn't discriminate when it's hungry.

entries.name: Slip in by Moonlight
entries: The gumienniki travel from the Lower Planes to the Material Plane whenever the moon is full. They delight in sacrificing captured humanoids or livestock in starlight, and the harvest moon is of particular importance to them. During the harvest moon, gumienniki are said to sprout flaming wings, which allow them to fly.

entries.name: Servants of the Harvest
entries: The gumienniki sometimes ally themselves with dark fertility cults in hidden groves, bringing blood sacrifices directly from their protected farmers to an altar. The farmers themselves may eventually be brought into the cult. The gumienniki may ally with a pack of {@creature roggenwolf|CCodex} or {@creature Rattok|CCodex|rattok demons} to starve entire villages. In a few cases, they become servants to vampires, spying on a village in their cat form and reporting any effort to resist the vampire's rule.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The snow hag can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Icy Embrace {@recharge 5}
entries: The snow hag exhales a cloud of freezing fog in a 15-foot-radius around her. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage and is {@condition restrained} by ice for 1 minute. On a success, a target takes half the damage and isn't {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 13} Strength check, shattering the ice on a success. The ice can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire and bludgeoning damage; immunity to slashing, cold, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have human hands, but someone touching them would feel her sharp claws. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

{@i Wrapped up against the cold in thick furs and a head scarf, this ugly old crone has a hooked nose, blue-tinged skin and long, clawed fingers. She trudges through the snow, leaning heavily on a gnarled staff.}
Snow hags live in the cold lands of the far north, making their homes in wooden cottages amidst the trees of the taiga or in remote mountainside caves.

entries.name: Evil Whispers
entries: Snow hags enjoy posing as kindly wise women, selling herbal remedies and lucky charms. These remedies will work at first, but their efficacy soon fades, prompting the buyer to ask for something more permanent. The hag is only too willing to help but will ask for a favor in return. This might involve spreading gossip about another villager or playing a "harmless" prank on a neighbor. Slowly but surely, things escalate until everyone in the village is at each other's throats, much to the hag's delight.

entries.name: Exiled for Ugliness
entries: The first snow hags were daughters of the {@creature Snow Queen|ToB} ({@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}), fathered by a hill giant lover she denies ever knowing. Appalled by their ugliness, the Snow Queen threw her offspring into the frozen wastes where they live to this day.

entries.name: Mothers of Beauty
entries: Snow hags reproduce by stealing human infants and eating them. A year and a day after consuming the infant, the hag gives birth to a beautiful {@creature ice maiden|ToB} ({@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}). The magical kiss of an ice maiden freezes the heart of a mortal, putting it under her spell, but this magic can be broken by the kiss of the victim's true love. If an ice maiden loses seven lovers in this way, she transforms into a snow hag.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The snow hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The herald of fire has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

trait.name: Hidden Herald
entries: The herald of fire can use its action to polymorph into a Medium dragonborn, Medium human, Small kobold, or back into its true draconic humanoid form. In each form, its eyes glow with magical fire and it wears a silver sword, revealing its identity as a herald. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying, other than the silver sword, transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the herald fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The herald's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Scales of Justice
entries: At the start of each of the herald's turns, each creature within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or speak only the truth until the start of the herald's next turn while within 30 feet of the herald.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
entries: The herald can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The herald of fire makes two fire claw attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Fire Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fiery Lance {@recharge 5}
entries: The herald magically shoots fire in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 15 feet away from the herald. On a success, a target takes half the damage and isn't pushed.

legendary.name: Fiery Claw
entries: The herald makes one fiery claw attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The herald makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Immolate Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The herald of fire calls down searing, crimson fire in a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point the herald can see within 120 feet of it. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed in flames and must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried ignite. The pillar of fire lasts until the herald uses this legendary action again or until the herald dies.

{@i Boasting shining, golden claws and crimson robes and smelling of smoke and ash, the bipedal dragon strode through the burning city, pointing its golden claw at certain homes and businesses. In each place, the soldiers found golden plunder to load on the wagons.}

The herald of fire is a living embodiment of fiery justice and burnt sacrifices to the draconic gods. In most cases, the herald appears when some great sacrilege has been committed against the faith of fire, such as the withholding of taxes and tribute, or the slaughter of dragons and their kin, or desecration of a temple.

entries.name: Fiery Eyes and Magical Sword
entries: Though the herald can assume the shape of a dragonborn, human, or kobold, it always has eyes filled with leaping flames, no matter its guise. This is far more obvious by night than in daylight. The herald often carries a magical sword of truth. It rarely uses this weapon in battle, for it is made of soft silver and inlaid with mithral and gold. However, all those near the sword find it quite difficult to lie.

entries.name: Quick to Anger
entries: While a herald of fire does seek justice and tribute for the dragon gods, it is known for its propensity to anger at slight provocations. In many cases, its anger leads it to shout, stamp its clawed feet, or smash objects around it. In a few cases, it performs immediate and even fatal judgment on the source of its annoyance. Afterwards, it generally claims to have acted entirely within the law and dares others to gainsay it.

trait.name: Aura of Immobility
entries: The herald of the great wyrm emits an area of antimagic within 60 feet of itself. This trait works like the {@spell antimagic field} spell, except it only affects magical travel. At the start of each of its turns, the herald chooses whether this aura is active. The aura prevents the herald's own magical traveling.

trait.name: Hidden Herald
entries: The herald of the great wyrm can use its action to polymorph into a Medium dragonborn, Medium human, Small kobold, or back into its true draconic humanoid form. In each form, its eyes glow with a magical light that shifts in color and it wears a silver key, revealing its identity as a herald. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying, other than the silver key, transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the herald of the great wyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Portal Mastery
entries: As a bonus action, the herald of the great wyrm can open any object that contains a mundane or magical means that prevents access. This trait works like the knock spell, except it dispels rather than suppresses arcane lock and it doesn't create an audible knock when used. Alternatively, the herald can use a bonus action to open or close any magical portal, road, gateway, or path.

trait.name: Portal Movement
entries: As a bonus action, the herald of the great wyrm can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see toward or away from a hostile creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The herald of the great wyrm makes two claw of fate attacks or two spectral barrier attacks. If both claw of fate attacks hit the same target, the target is {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained}, the target takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) radiant damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature, including the target, can take an action to make a {@dc 17} Strength check, ending the {@condition restrained} condition on a success. The herald can restrain only two creatures at a time in this way.

action.name: Claw of Fate
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Spectral Barrier
entries: Ranged Magical Attack. {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by magical bands of force for 1 minute. A creature, including the target, can take its action to burst the bands of force by succeeding on a {@dc 17} Strength check.

legendary.name: Claw of Fate
entries: The herald makes one claw of fate attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The herald makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Black Well of Unmaking (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: The herald of the great wyrm creates a 5-foot-sphere of void matter on a point it can see within 120 feet of it. At the start of each of the herald's turns, each creature other than the herald within 30 feet of the well of unmaking must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward the well. Each creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the well must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. The well of unmaking lasts until the herald uses this legendary action again or until the herald dies.

{@i Doors flew open, and gates lifted as the draconic humanoid approached the castle. All locks failed, and a glowing portal opened between the roots of the courtyard chestnut tree. It opened its mouth to speak the words of the dragon gods.}

entries.name: Opener of the Ways
entries: Rare indeed is the arrival of a herald of the Great Wyrm, the Keeper of Portals, the Opener of the Ways and Lord of Dragons. All locks, stoppers, chests, wards, and doors are said to spring open when it treads near, and gates and shadow portals pop into existence at its bidding. The herald of the great wyrm is a sign that the eye of dragonkind is upon a particular place or person—perhaps the thief of a great treasure, perhaps a great treasure to be taken.

entries.name: Keeper of Knowledge
entries: The herald of the Great Wyrm knows of all scrolls, books, maps, and even carvings and graffiti within 10 miles of its location. No source of lore or writing can be hidden from it.

trait.name: Creeping Death
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the herald must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The herald's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The herald has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The herald of undeath makes two reaping scythe attacks or uses its Ray of Annihilation twice. If both reaping scythe attacks hit the same target, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or it is reduced to 0 hp.

action.name: Reaping Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Ray of Annihilation
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

{@i Skeletal and towering over the battle, the herald of undeath blasts the living in the name of its dark lord: "Hail the age of apocalypse, for your death is here! I shall reap you all into my master's fold, for I am the end times made flesh!"}

Fresh from the land of the dead, a herald of undeath is an enormous, undead servitor of the dark gods of undeath. It is often accompanied by {@creature flutterflesh|ToB} ({@loader Tome of Beasts|creature/Kobold Press; Tome of Beasts.json}) scouts or a pack of wraiths, and it travels as a messenger to a {@creature hierophant lich|CCodex} or an evil high priest. The herald of undeath walks tirelessly to spread its master's grim message of death, doom, and decay.

entries.name: Shrieking Bones
entries: When struck by magic or by a magical weapon, the bones of the herald cry out in pain with the voices of the damned.

entries.name: Separable Limbs and Eyes
entries: The herald of undeath can detach its various limbs at any time, leaving them to act independently. It will often leave an eyeball somewhere to keep watch on a particular location.

entries.name: Raises Entire Cemeteries
entries: A herald of undeath can and will raise entire undead armies from large cemeteries, battlefields, or necropoli. There is no limit to the number of undead that will follow a herald of undeath, and even intelligent undead are not immune to its clarion call. Tribes of gnolls sometimes follow them, seeking chaos and easy plunder.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A herald of undeath doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The horned serpent can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Corpse Cough
entries: Those who fail a saving throw against the horned serpent's Gem Gaze or bite attack become infected with the corpse cough disease. The infected creature can't benefit from short or long rests due to a constant, wet cough. The infected creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw each day or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until the target is cured of the disease with a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic. If the infected creature comes into physical contact with a blood relative before the disease is cured, the relative must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or also become infected with the disease. The blood relative is afflicted with a constant, wet cough within hours of infection, but the disease's full effects don't manifest until {@dice 1d4} days later. Corpse cough is so named due to the smell of the cough as the infected creature's lungs become necrotic.

trait.name: Poisonous Aura
entries: At the start of each of the horned serpent's turns, each creature within 20 feet of it must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Shielded Mind
entries: The horned serpent is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horned serpent makes one gore attack and one bite attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become infected with the corpse cough disease (see the Corpse Cough trait).

action.name: Gem Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The horned serpent's gem flashes, bathing a 30-foot cone in iridescent light. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) radiant damage and is infected with the corpse cough disease (see the Corpse Cough trait). On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't infected with the disease. Gem Gaze has no effect on constructs and undead.
{@i This huge snake has a pair of wide horns, like those of a bull, and a smooth, opaque, red, ovoid stone between its eyes that gives off a faint glow.}

entries.name: Plague Bearers
entries: Known to be a bringer of magical plagues, horned serpents are also sought after for their horns and the strange stones between their eyes, both believed to have powerful curative properties.

entries.name: Wilderness Wanderer
entries: Horned serpents travel between lakes, ponds, and deep rivers, never staying in one area for more than a few seasons. Though they live primarily in the water, they venture onto the land to hunt, where the sweetness of their poisonous scent draws game to them.

entries.name: Grisly Signs
entries: The presence of a horned serpent is most often detected by an area of dead creatures, poisoned but otherwise untouched.

trait.name: Entrance By Corners
entries: The hound of Tindalos may only enter the Material Plane at a sharp intersection of surfaces. As a bonus action, the hound can teleport from one location to another within sight of the first, provided it travels from one sharp corner to another.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The hound of Tindalos has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The hound of Tindalos has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the hound of Tindalos moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the hound of Tindalos can make one tongue attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The hound of Tindalos has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hound of Tindalos makes two claw attacks and one bite attack. It can make one tongue attack in place of its two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) косой урон.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Hunter of the Lost
entries: The hound can transport itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the plane shift spell, except the hound can only affect itself, not other creatures, and can't use it to banish an unwilling creature to another plane.
{@i Stepping through corners of otherwise solid walls, the hairless doglike creatures coated in blue ichor are relentless pursuers able to cross dimensional barriers in pursuit of prey.}

entries.name: Hunters from the Void
entries: Hideous and strange creatures from the Void, hounds of Tindalos hunt those who travel the planes of existence or break the bonds of time. None know if the hounds take offense to travel through time and space or if there is some quality of such travelers that they find irresistible, but, once they have the scent of such a creature, they rarely lose it. They hunt without rest, draining the creature of all fluids with long, hollow tongues once caught, leaving behind little more than a husk. They possess intelligence and the ability to speak, but no society or civilization of their kind has ever been witnessed. They live only to hunt.

entries.name: A Taste for Humanity
entries: Hounds of Tindalos prefer human prey even when presented with other options.

entries.name: Hideous Beasts
entries: The hound resembles a hairless dog, but its forelimbs end in remarkably human-looking hands. It has the head of a bat with large, luminous eyes and a short black beak, sharp as a razor. Notches in the center of the top and bottom of the beak allow a long, blue, hollow proboscis to snake out for feeding. Its skin color varies, though nodules along the hound's spine ooze a blue ichor that coats it most of the time.

monster.name: Gaki
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Aura of Famine
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 10 feet of a gaki, it is overwhelmed by a hunger that dissolves fat and atrophies muscle. It must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Gluttonous Attraction
entries: At the start of its turn, if a creature can see the gaki, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is overcome with a desire to kill and eat the ghost, and it must move as close to the gaki as it can.

trait.name: Hungry Frenzy
entries: The gaki has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The gaki can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gaki makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Spit Acid
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage.
{@i A wretched spirit, at once both emaciated and bloated, stuffs huge handfuls of filth from a dung heap into its gaping, toothy maw.}

The gaki, or hungry ghosts, are restless spirits of avaricious humans, cursed by the gods to live eternally in constant hunger. This hunger manifests itself as an insatiable desire to consume filth or cannibalistically devour human carrion. A hungry ghost appears as a hairless human with deep, bruised-blue skin stretched tight over both its emaciated ribs and its pendulous belly.

entries.name: Desperate Hunger
entries: Gaki rarely hunt mortal creatures. Though gaki can kill mortal creatures and devour their flesh, they find the rancid taste of carrion far more appetizing. When gaki do attack humanoids, it is because that mortal is keeping it from eating. Gaki cursed to eternally feed on feces, for instance, stalk outhouses and viciously attack the creatures relieving themselves within, as the gaki believes the creatures are guarding their rightful meal.

entries.name: Esoteric Devourers
entries: A hungry ghost is cursed to consume a single thing for eternity. Usually the object of their hunger is disgusting refuse like feces or garbage, but some gaki have more unusual tastes. Often, these tastes ironically reflect the sins these spirits committed in life. Gaki are generally benign, but the hungers that put them in conflict with civilized creatures—such as hungering for gold, clothing, magical scrolls—are the most destructive of all.

entries.name: Hungry Dead Nature
entries: The hungry ghost doesn't require air or sleep.

monster.name: Preta
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The preta can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The preta uses its Blood Siphon. It then makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) косой урон.

action.name: Blood Siphon
entries: The preta magically draws the blood from a target it can see within 30 feet into its ever-hungry mouth. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) points of necrotic damage. The preta regains hp equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The preta magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Hidden Illusionist
entries: The preta turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses Blood Siphon, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While {@condition invisible}, it leaves no physical evidence of its passage, leaving it traceable only by magic. Any equipment the preta wears or carriers is {@condition invisible} with it. While {@condition invisible}, the preta can create small illusory sounds and images like the minor illusion spell except it can create either two images, two sounds, or one sound and one image.
{@i The emaciated creature smacks its withered lips in hungry anticipation as it reaches out with taloned claws.}

In Eastern lands when men and women huddle in their homes behind stout shutters, they know the scratch of claws upon the door heralds an unending hunger for blood. Preta appear as human-like undead with sunken, mummified skin, narrow limbs, distended bellies and wide, unblinking eyes.

entries.name: The Hungry Ghost
entries: In many traditions, the preta is a pitiful creature suffering maddening hunger that can never be sated. They are often servants to blood cultists or ghouls.

entries.name: Blood-Drinking Trickster
entries: While some only desire love or food or companionship, the dangerous preta are the ones who hunger for blood. These preta roam the countryside picking off travelers or isolated farmers. They use their invisibility and mastery of illusions to mask their approach until it is too late for their prey to flee.

entries.name: Hungry Dead Nature
entries: The hungry ghost doesn't require air or sleep.

trait.name: Draconic Predator
entries: The ichneumon is immune to a dragon's Frightful Presence and has advantage on saving throws against the breath weapons of dragons.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the ichneumon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the ichneumon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The ichneumon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Mud Armor
entries: If the ichneumon spends an hour applying mud to itself, it can increase its AC by 2 for 8 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ichneumon makes three attacks. two with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the ichneumon can't use its bite on another target.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.
{@i With powerful jaws and teeth capable of shearing scales from meat with ease, the creature resembles a weasel the size of a brown bear.}

entries.name: Outsized Temerity
entries: These creatures live in burrows and caves whose previous inhabitants were likely devoured by the new residents. Wily hunters, ichneumons prey upon all kinds of creatures, but they go to great lengths and far out of their way to feast on dragon eggs, or the dragons themselves if they can.

entries.name: Resourceful Rodent
entries: Ichneumons have a keen animal intelligence, and they make an innovative use of their environment. A musky oil with insulating properties coats the fur of an ichneumon, granting it a measure of protection. When an ichneumon has the luxury of time to prepare before hunting, it finds the nearest source of mud and applies layer after layer to itself. The mud bonds with the creature's oily coat and forms a hard, thick outer armor, enhancing its natural protections.

entries.name: Hunted and Hated
entries: The ichneumon's very existence is a source of humiliation and outrage for dragonkind. The mention of a dragon's name who was killed by an ichneumon is considered distasteful among dragons once they have hunted for the killer and settled the matter. Different standards of decency apply for other beings, however, and any non-dragon foolish enough to mention an ichneumon within hearing of a dragon might never be heard from again.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ijiraq's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Memory Loss
entries: After encountering an ijiraq, a creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw to remember the events. On a failure, the details of the encounter rapidly fade away from the creature's mind, including the presence of the ijiraq.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: In its true form, the ijiraq makes two claw attacks. In its hybrid form, it makes one gore attack and one claw attack.

action.name: Gore (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Claw (Hybrid Form or True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Invisibility (True Form Only)
entries: The ijiraq magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). It may choose whether equipment it wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it or not.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The ijiraq magically polymorphs into any beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, into its caribou-human hybrid form, or back into its true from. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the ijiraq's choice).

While in its true form or its hybrid form, its statistics are the same. When in a beast form, the ijiraq retains its alignment, hp, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

{@i A bipedal caribou adorned with spiked horns stalks the edge of the forest. Its melodious voice calls to hunters, telling them of clean springs, a fine honeycomb, and easy prey just a little further ahead.}

While their true forms are invisible to most, ijiraq are often seen wandering the wilds in the form of beasts or terrible caribouhuman hybrids. If seen in their true forms, they resemble short humans with horrifying features.

entries.name: Hunters of Man
entries: Ijiraq are known to abduct humans to use for sport. Many will carry skulls of their kills as trophies, and they have a fondness for the taste of human meat. At times, they do pretend to be guides to some hidden shrine or a flock of fat geese, to lure a hunter away from others. However, they view it as poor form to attack humans that come to speak with them and will treat such people with respect during a moot.

entries.name: Loathing of the Sea
entries: The ijiraq detest open waters, the creatures that live within them, and goods that come from them. Many villages have found safety from ijiraq by relocating close to the water's edge.

trait.name: Magma Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the weapon becomes stuck in the elemental. If the weapon's wielder can't or won't let go of the weapon, the wielder is {@condition grappled} while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. Until the grapple ends, the wielder takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. To end the grapple, the wielder can release the weapon or pull it free by taking an action to make a {@dc 16} Strength check and succeeding.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The incinis makes two magma fist attacks.

action.name: Magma Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Wave of Magma {@recharge 5}
entries: The incinis transforms into a wave of magma, moving up to its speed in a straight line. Each creature in the path where the incinis moves must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and, if it is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed ahead of the incinis and knocked {@condition prone} in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of where the incinis ends its movement. On a success, a target takes half the damage and is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

{@i This unusual elemental seems to be made from magma and fire. Its skin is pitch black with glowing cracks forming and closing as it moves. Its face is featureless, except for a great flaming maw that sputters and smokes as it speaks.}

entries.name: Curious
entries: Incinis are naturally curious creatures, and though they savor the taste of the living, they are likely to greet newcomers before attacking. An incinis is not naive or easily fooled, and it resorts to violence the instant it senses treachery or lies.

entries.name: Volcanic Spirits
entries: The incinis are often found on or near pools of magma, and seem to be capable to shaping and directing the flows of lava from active volcanoes.

entries.name: Elemental Nature
entries: The incinis doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monster.name: Inkling
languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The inkling can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: A Thirst for Knowledge
entries: If an inkling spends 24 hours with a spellbook or a spell scroll, it can learn the magic of one 2ndlevel or lower spell, erasing and absorbing all the ink and magic used to inscribe the spell. The inkling can then cast the spell once per day.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The inkling has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) косой урон.
{@i A small, sentient pool of magical ink, shimmering in the light, flows along the bookshelf.}

An inkling forms when dormant magic sparks to life in a long-unused spellbook. It can take on any form it wishes, although it rarely exceeds a height and width of six inches. It usually chooses the form of a puddle and flows in and around books. It can seep through even the tiniest cracks in its surroundings, making its search for hidden knowledge an easier task.

entries.name: Wizards' Bane
entries: Inklings possess a wizard's natural thirst for knowledge. Arcane casters must be careful, for inklings are disastrous to find in a wizard's library, craving knowledge and stealing the ink and the knowledge of spells for themselves. Inklings are primarily solitary entities. However, if enough spellbooks or scrolls are stored in one location, a horde of inklings can sometimes form.

entries.name: Clever Pets
entries: Some inklings have been caught by the wizards they tried to plague. Those not destroyed are kept by such wizards and can be trained to search out a rival's books and bring back knowledge. While not forced by any binding or magical curse, the inklings still follow those they consider their masters, as they crave the acquisition of the arcane their masters provide. As long as the "master" keeps the inkling well-supplied with scrolls and other magical writings, it remains a loyal companion.

entries.name: Innate Casters
entries: Inklings are naturally in tune with the arcane elements of the world and know the inner workings of spells. Not only can they cast some of the basic spells of wizards, they can also sometimes alter the nature of a spell already cast. This is quite helpful if they are ever discovered in a wizard's abode and need to make an escape.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: The inkling doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

reaction.name: Redirect Spell
entries: If a spell attack hits the inkling, it can force the attacker to make a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw. If the attacker fails the saving throw, the spell is redirected to hit another creature of the inkling's choice within 30 feet.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The inkling's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only somatic components:

monster.name: Iron Sphere
languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The sphere is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The sphere deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The sphere can launch itself into the air by extending the rods within it like pistons. The sphere's long jump is up to 25 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The sphere can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 5-foot-wide, 5-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The iron sphere makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Piston
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} попадание, досягаемость 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) колющего урона.

action.name: Lightning Cannon {@recharge 5}
entries: The sphere extends a metal rod from one of its many facets and fires a bolt of lightning in a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i An iron ball covered in black panels sits at the statue's feet. It seems slightly out of place, its surface smooth and bright.}

entries.name: Hidden Threat
entries: From a distance, the iron sphere appears to be a ball four feet in diameter. Closer inspection reveals square plates in the sphere, each crowned by a black hemisphere. Iron spheres usually find placement as art objects, sometimes incorporated into statuary displays or among white stones, vases, or other decorative notions.

entries.name: Unpredictable Opponent
entries: Once the iron sphere becomes active, it rolls toward a threat, deploying what weapons it deems necessary by means of the pistons beneath each plate on its exterior. Some pop open like a chest's lid, some fire outward, and others split open to reveal a blade, a spike, or a nozzle.

entries.name: Direct Control or Set to Guard
entries: The owner of an iron sphere gives it commands through a gem, which can be concealed inside the plate at the topmost part of the sphere when not being used to control the sphere.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: The inkling doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The jaanavar jal can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The jaanavar jal regains 10 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp. If the jaanavar jal takes cold damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The jaanavar jal dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hp and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jaanavar jal makes two attacks. one with its bite and one to constrict.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage Constrict. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained} and the jaanavar jal can't constrict another creature.

action.name: Flaming Oil Spittle {@recharge 5}
entries: The jaanavar jal expels a line of burning oil that is 40 feet long and 5 feet wide from glands beside its mouth. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@i The massive white worm opens its gaping maw, revealing two square teeth, and spews flaming oil onto its prey.}

Exploding out of the river, the jaanavar jal, also known as the burning beast, is the scourge of the slow-moving rivers of the East. Though dim-witted, jaanavar jal is a canny predator who consumes anything it can catch.

entries.name: River Ambusher
entries: The jaanavar jal is known to ambush herd animals, fishermen and even whole boats, spewing flaming oil from its gaping maw to roast its prey before feasting.

entries.name: Valuable Oils
entries: The glands that produce the flaming oil (naphtha) are prized among the alchemists of the East. The brave, or perhaps foolish, hunters who manage to bring down a burning beast can make their fortunes with a single kill.

monster.name: Jiangshi
languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Blind Senses
entries: The jiangshi can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The jiangshi has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Prayer of Magic Resistance
entries: The jiangshi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. A creature can take its action while within 5 feet of the jiangshi to rip the prayer off the jiangshi by succeeding on a {@dc 16} Strength check. The jiangshi loses this trait if its prayer scroll is removed.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The jiangshi's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Terrifying Appearance
entries: When a creature that can see the jiangshi starts its turn within 30 feet of the jiangshi, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, unless the jiangshi is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the jiangshi's Terrifying Appearance for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jiangshi makes two claw attacks. It can use Life Drain in place of one claw attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature and the jiangshi doesn't have two other creatures {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the jiangshi, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.
A humanoid slain in this way rises 24 hours later as a jiangshi, unless the humanoid is restored to life, its body is bathed in vinegar before burial, or its body is destroyed.

{@i Its sickly-green, glowing skin covered in tattered robes, the undead creature lurches forward with a stiff, hopping motion, and baring claw-like hands. A thin strip of paper covered in tiny writing hangs from its hat.}

entries.name: Inauspicious Burials
entries: A jiangshi is created when burial rites are carried out improperly. Unable to leave the body, the tortured soul re-animates the corpse after rigor mortis has set in, giving the jiangshi its rigid posture and nickname as a "hopping vampire." A jiangshi has a burial prayer written on a small scroll stitched to its forehead or hat, warding it against magic.

entries.name: Bizarre Gaits
entries: Stiff-limbed and hunched, jiangshi move around by hopping, rather than walking, in search of living prey. It can make enormous leaps to catch a foe, and, when it grabs hold of a victim, it sucks out the creature's breath. Jiangshi are blind, detecting living victims by listening for the sounds of breathing. It is possible to remain undetected by a jiangshi by holding one's breath and keeping very still.

entries.name: Hungry Dead Nature
entries: The jiangshi doesn't require air or sleep.

trait.name: Burrowing Roots
entries: Whenever the jinmenju makes a root attack, it can choose a point on the ground within 120 feet of it. The root bursts from the ground, and that point becomes the attack's point of origin. After attacking, the exposed root protrudes from that point, and the jinmenju gains a reaction each turn that it can only use to make an opportunity attack with that root. A root has AC 15, 45 hp, and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. Damaging a root doesn't damage the jinmenju tree. The jinmenju can have up to 5 roots active at one time. If it makes a root attack while it has 5 roots active, one of the active roots burrows back into the ground and a new root appears at the location of the new attack.

trait.name: Laughing Fruit
entries: If a creature with Intelligence 5 or higher eats a bite of the fruit of the jinmenju, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone}, becoming {@condition incapacitated} by fits of laughter as it perceives everything as hilariously funny for 1 minute.
